intro: Chaetoptelea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Chaetoptelea mexicana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in dry forests and shrublands.
